intro: Johrenia dichotoma subsp. dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous johrenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or woodland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
